result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Tancy E Helmin was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Payment plan is $50.00 per month to begin January 1, 2017.
Bond to be applied.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Tancy E Helmin in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR1351, 15TR1373 & 15TR1374 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the parties are stipulating to amending Ct. 2 to OWI - 2nd offense.    Atty Hendee states plea agreemen to the amended Ct. 2, 15TR1373 & 15TR1374.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in and Ct. 3 to be dismissed. 15TR1351 to be dismissed.  Atty Johnson has provided the certified documents for a prior conviction that could not be proved and showing that there was no prior conviction.
BY THE COURT:  Count 2 is amended to OWI - 2nd offense.

Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea to the amended Ct. 2, OWI - 2nd offense.  
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 2 to OWI - 2nd offense, 15TR1373 & 15TR1374.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in and Ct. 3 to be dismissed. 15TR1351 to be dismissed. 

Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.  
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 2, OWI - 2nd offense:  Court orders 38 days in the Marquette County Jail 
Report on or before February 3, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*Pay fine and costs = $1,494.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*17 month DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
*AODA and any follow-up treatment 
bond to be applied
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on January 1, 2017

Ct. 1 to be dismissed and read-in 
Ct. 3 to be dismissed. 
15TR1351 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Final pre-trial on November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
